titles.title: VentDB: Juan de Fuca Ridge, CoAxial, Mid-Ocean Ridge Hydrothermal Vent Chemistry Data Collection. Butterfield (1997)

resource.publisher: EarthChem Library(ECL) | Interdisciplinary Earth Data Alliance (IEDA) | Columbia University; doi:10.17616/R3V644

rightsList.rights: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0]

descriptions.description: Collection of hydrothermal vent fluid chemistry data from VentDB, Juan de Fuca ridge, CoAxial - Raw and end-member data for major and minor species and ammonium. This file is just one part of a much larger effort (VentDB) to make available to the scientific community as much hydrothermal ridge vent chemistry data as possible (for a list of all the VentDB related data collections available, search the EarthChem Library for the term “VentDB”). For more information about this compilation, please see “Explanatory Notes and Master Chemical Item Spreadsheet for the VentDB Data Collections housed in the EarthChem Library” (M. Mottl), available at www.earthchem.org/library.

Related publications: Butterfield, D.A., I.R. Jonasson, G.J. Massoth, R.A. Feely, K.K. Roe, R.E. Embley, J.F. Holden, R.E. McDuff, M.D. Lilley, and J.R. Delaney (1997), Seafloor eruptions and evolution of hydrothermal fluid chemistry, Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London, Series A, 355, 369-386

geoLocation.geoLocationPlace: Juan de Fuca Ridge, CoAxial, Pacific Ocean
